basics.name: Glenn Galvizo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences, and a certicate in Mathematical Biology at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2018.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI
courses: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I-II

work.summary: Research and optimize five blind star identification algorithms.
highlights: Implemented three different blind star identification algorithms, as well as a unit testing framework and benchmark data generator in Python and C++.
Implementing two more algorithms, and plan to create a more optimal solution based on these five.

work.summary: Mentor 4th-12th grade students in the development, design, and application of robotics through VEX.
highlights: Guide, mentor, and coach elementary to high school students in creating VEX competition robots.
Students are taught the basics of mechanical design, documentation, C-based programming, game strategy, and teamwork.

work.company: University of Hawaii Information and Computer Sciences
work.summary: Manage lab machines for ICS department.
highlights: Helped managed four labs of computers, users and their networks.
Developed Powershell scripts to automate Active Directory user account renewal and additions.
Developed various batch scripts for unattended program installation and lab-wide application updates.

work.summary: Lead High level software student portions for NMSR and star tracker project.
highlights: Managed a Unix Gumstix device for a stationary payload on a sounding rocket.
Developed cross-platform memory/load/disk library for COSMOS project.
Developed COSMOS visualization tools with QT C++ Framework.
Created COSMOS agent and libraries for star based attitude estimation, and IMU based attitude estimation.

volunteer.summary: Ensure robotics game is played in fair and consistent manner.
Managed minutes and information regarding our meetings and community service events.

awards.title: UROP Project Awardee
awards.summary: Awarded research grant for proposing Hoku project to the commitee.

awards.title: Cadet 4th Class of the Month
awards.awarder: Detachment 175 Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps
awards.summary: Surpass peers in drill and warrior knowledge in a board enviroment.
